{{Day}}

==Events==
* [[668]] &ndash; [[Byzantine Empire|Eastern Roman Emperor]] [[Constans II (Byzantine Empire)|Constans II]] is assassinated in his bath at [[Syracuse, Italy]].
* [[921]] &ndash; At Tetin, [[Saint Ludmila]] is murdered at the command of her [[daughter-in-law]].
* [[994]] &ndash; Major [[Fatimid]] victory over the [[Byzantine Empire]] at the [[Battle of the Orontes]].
*[[1440]] &ndash; [[Gilles de Rais]], one of the earliest known [[serial killer]]s, is taken into custody upon an accusation brought against him by the [[Bishop of Nantes]].
*[[1556]] &ndash; Departing from [[Vlissingen]], ex-[[Holy Roman Emperor]] [[Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor|Charles V]] returns to [[Spain]].
*[[1616]] &ndash; The first non-aristocratic, free public school in Europe is opened in [[Frascati]], [[Italy]].
*[[1762]] &ndash; [[Seven Years' War]]: [[Battle of Signal Hill]].
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] forces land at [[Landing at Kip's Bay|Kip's Bay]] during the [[New York Campaign]].
*[[1789]] &ndash; The [[United States Department of State]] is established (formerly known as the "Department of Foreign Affairs").
*[[1812]] &ndash; The [[France|French]] army under [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon]] reaches [[the Kremlin]] in [[Moscow]].
*  1812   &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: A second supply train sent to relieve [[Siege of Fort Harrison|Fort Harrison]] is ambushed in the [[Battle of Fort Harrison#Attacks at the Narrows|Attack at the Narrows]].
*[[1816]] &ndash; [[HMS Whiting (1812)|HMS Whiting]] ran aground on the [[Doom Bar]]
*[[1820]] &ndash; [[History of Portugal#Crises of the nineteenth century|Constitutionalist revolution]] in [[Lisbon]], [[Portugal]].
*[[1821]] &ndash; [[Guatemala]], [[El Salvador]], [[Honduras]], [[Nicaragua]], and [[Costa Rica]] jointly declare independence from [[Spain]].
*[[1830]] &ndash; The [[Opening of the Liverpool and Manchester Railway|Liverpool to Manchester railway line opens]].
*[[1831]] &ndash; The [[locomotive]] ''[[John Bull (locomotive)|John Bull]]'' operates for the first time in [[New Jersey]] on the [[Camden and Amboy Railroad]].
*[[1835]] &ndash; {{HMS|Beagle}}, with [[Charles Darwin]] aboard, reaches the [[Galápagos Islands]]. The ship lands at Chatham or [[San Cristóbal Island|San Cristobal]], the easternmost of the archipielago.
*[[1851]] &ndash; [[Saint Joseph's University]] is founded in [[Philadelphia]], [[Pennsylvania]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] forces capture [[Harpers Ferry, West Virginia|Harpers Ferry, Virginia]].
*[[1873]] &ndash; [[Franco-Prussian War]]: The last [[Germany|German]] troops leave [[France]] upon completion of payment of indemnity.
*[[1894]] &ndash; [[Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895)|First Sino-Japanese War]]: [[Empire of Japan|Japan]] defeats [[Qing Dynasty|China]] in the [[Battle of Pyongyang]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Tank]]s are used for the first time in battle, at the [[Battle of the Somme (1916)|Battle of the Somme]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; India's first all-boys public school, [[The Doon School]], is founded.
*[[1935]] &ndash; The [[Nuremberg Laws]] deprive [[History of the Jews in Germany|German Jews]] of [[citizenship]].
*  1935   &ndash; [[Nazi Germany]] adopts a new [[Flag of Germany|national flag]] with the [[swastika]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The climax of the [[Battle of Britain]], when the [[Royal Air Force]] shoots down large numbers of [[Luftwaffe]] aircraft.
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: [[United States Navy|U.S. Navy]] [[aircraft carrier]] {{USS|Wasp|CV-7|6}} is sunk by a Japanese torpedo at [[Guadalcanal]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] and [[Winston Churchill]] meet in [[Quebec]] as part of the [[Second Quebec Conference|Octagon Conference]] to discuss strategy.
*  1944   &ndash; [[Battle of Peleliu]] begins as the [[United States Marine Corps]]' [[1st Marine Division]] and the [[United States Army]]'s [[81st Infantry Division (United States)|81st Infantry Division]] hit White and Orange beaches under heavy fire from Japanese infantry and artillery.
*[[1945]] &ndash; A hurricane in southern [[Florida]] and the [[Bahamas]] destroys 366 planes and 25 blimps at NAS Richmond.
*[[1947]] &ndash; [[RCA]] releases the [[12AX7]] [[vacuum tube]].
*  1947   &ndash; [[1940–49 Pacific typhoon seasons|Typhoon Kathleen]] hit the Kanto Region in Japan killing 1,077.
*[[1948]] &ndash; The [[F-86 Sabre]] sets the world aircraft speed record at {{convert|671|mph|km/h}}.
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Korean War]]: [[United States]] forces [[Battle of Inchon|land at Inchon]]
*[[1952]] &ndash; The [[United Nations]] cedes [[Eritrea]] to [[Ethiopia]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; A [[Central Railroad of New Jersey]] commuter train [[Newark Bay rail accident|runs through an open drawbridge]] at the [[Newark Bay]], killing 48.
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Nikita Khrushchev]] becomes the first [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] leader to visit the [[United States]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Hurricane Carla]] strikes [[Texas]] with winds of 175 miles per hour.
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] ship ''[[Poltava]]'' heads toward [[Cuba]], one of the events that sets into motion the [[Cuban Missile Crisis]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[16th Street Baptist Church bombing]]: Four children killed at an [[African-American church]] in [[Birmingham, Alabama]], [[United States]]
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Lyndon B. Johnson]], responding to a [[Charles Whitman|sniper attack]] at the [[University of Texas at Austin]], writes a letter to [[United States Congress|Congress]] urging the enactment of [[gun control]] legislation.
*[[1968]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] ''[[Zond 5]]'' spaceship is launched, becoming the first spacecraft to fly around the [[Moon]] and re-enter the [[Earth]]'s atmosphere.
*[[1972]] &ndash; A [[Scandinavian Airlines System]] domestic flight from [[Gothenburg]] to [[Stockholm]] is hijacked and flown to [[Malmö-Bulltofta Airport]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Air Vietnam Flight 706]] is hijacked, then crashes while attempting to land with 75 on board.
*[[1975]] &ndash; The [[France|French]] [[Departments of France|department]] of "[[Corsica|Corse]]" (the entire island of [[Corsica]]) is divided into two: [[Haute-Corse]] (Upper Corsica) and [[Corse-du-Sud]] (Southern Corsica)
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Muhammad Ali]] outpointed [[Leon Spinks]] in a rematch to become the first boxer to win the world heavyweight title 3 times at the [[Superdome]] in [[New Orleans]].
*[[1981]] &ndash; The [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary|Senate Judiciary Committee]] unanimously approves [[Sandra Day O'Connor]] to become the first female justice of the [[Supreme Court of the United States]]
*  1981   &ndash; The [[John Bull (locomotive)|John Bull]] becomes the oldest operable [[steam locomotive]] in the world when the [[Smithsonian Institution]] operates it under its own power outside [[Washington, D.C.]]
*  1981   &ndash; [[Vanuatu]] becomes a member of the [[United Nations]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Israel]]i [[premier]] [[Menachem Begin]] resigns.
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[United States Secretary of State]] [[George Shultz]] and [[Soviet Foreign Minister]] [[Eduard Shevardnadze]] sign a treaty to establish centers to reduce the risk of nuclear war.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[France]] announces it will send 4,000 troops to the [[Persian Gulf]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Liechtenstein]] [[Prince]] [[Hans-Adam II]] disbands [[Parliament of Liechtenstein|Parliament]]
*[[1998]] &ndash; With the landmark merger of [[WorldCom]] and [[MCI Communications]] completed the day prior, the new [[MCI WorldCom]] opens its doors for business.
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[National Hockey League]] commissioner [[Gary Bettman]] announces [[2004–05 NHL lockout|lockout]] of the [[NHL Players Association|players union]] and cessation of operations by the NHL head office.
*[[2007]]  &ndash; [[Colin McRae]] dies when the helicopter he was piloting crashes near his [[Lanarkshire]] home.
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[Lehman Brothers]] files for [[Chapter 11, Title 11, United States Code|Chapter 11]] bankruptcy, the largest bankruptcy filing in U.S. history.

==Holidays and observances==
*[[Battle of Britain#Battle of Britain Day|Battle of Britain Day]] ([[United Kingdom]])
*Christian [[Calendar of saints|Feast Day]]:
**[[Catherine of Genoa]]
**[[Joseph Abibos]]
**[[Saint Nicomedes|Nicomedes]]
**[[Our Lady of Sorrows]]
**[[September 15 (Eastern Orthodox liturgics)]].
* "[[Public holidays in Mexico|Cry of Dolores]]" or ''[[Grito de Dolores]]'', celebrated on the eve of the [[Mexican War of Independence|Independence Day]] ([[Mexico]]).
*Earliest day on which [[German-American Steuben Parade]] can fall, while September 21 is the latest; celebrated on the third Saturday in September. ([[United States]], especially [[New York City]])
*Earliest day on which [[National POW/MIA Recognition Day|POW/MIA Recognition Day]] can fall, while September 21 is the latest; celebrated on the third Friday in September. ([[United States]])
*Earliest day on which ''[[Prinsjesdag]]'' can fall, while September 21 is the latest; celebrated on the third Tuesday in September. ([[Netherlands]])
*Earliest day on which [[Respect for the Aged Day]] can fall, while September 21 is the latest; celebrated on the third Monday in September. ([[Japan]])
* [[Engineer's Day]] ([[India]])
* [[Independence Day]], celebrates the independence of [[Guatemala]] (a [[Días Patrios (Guatemala)|Patriotic Day]]), [[El Salvador]], [[Honduras]], [[Nicaragua]], and [[Costa Rica]] from [[Spain]] in 1821.
* [[International Day of Democracy]] ([[International observance|International]])
* [[Public holidays in Azerbaijan#Other observances|Knowledge Day]] ([[Azerbaijan]])
* [[Public holidays in Slovenia|Restoration of Primorska to the Motherland Day]] ([[Slovenia]])
* [[Silpa Bhirasri|Silpa Bhirasri Day]] ([[Thailand]]).
* The beginning of [[National Hispanic Heritage Month]], celebrated until October 15 ([[United States]])
* [[World Lymphoma Awareness Day]] ([[International observance|International]])
